website_summaries.verdict: A good pick for quick cleanups, hard floors, small debris, and anyone who needs an extremely lightweight and affordable stick model.
pros: An inexpensive, updated stick vac with a removable handle that enables you to use it as a handheld vac
cons: doesn't work well on high-pile carpet
Swivel head is convenient when it works, but it tends to jam

customer_reviews.title: SO ANNOYED.
customer_reviews.text: Literally just stopped “vacuuming” so I could post this- I could NOT BE MORE ANNOYED!! The largest glass of wine is currently being poured. I didn’t expect wonders from this thing- we have wood floors and stone throughout the entire house so I bought this SOLELY for the purpose of cleaning the 1 area rug, and the three small rugs in our kitchen and bath. Plus vacuuming the corners of the couch. The handheld vacuum may work, but WOW I have never met a more incompetent vacuum in my entire life. When the flat head is on, to vacuum my rugs, it literally has no suction. I suck better on the regular. Beyond annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product for cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Great little vacuum! Needed a small little vacuum to clean my studio apartment and this did the job! Once you turn it on you will be surprised about the suction this little guy has! Cord was plenty long enough and the accessories worked perfectly. The quality of the vacuum body is better than the attachments, but for the price you can’t beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Geddis

customer_reviews.title: HELP! Need an extra filter!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this stick vacuum. Great suction and pick up power.....BUT, I have been unable to find an additional filter to purchase. My original filter is dirty, I've cleaned it and am waiting for it to dry, but this puts the vacuum out of commission until I find an additional filter OR this one dries, which looks like is going to take at least 24 hours. I've emailed Eureka to try to resolve this issue. Looking forward to being able to use my 3 in 1 again....
customer_reviews.author: Susan Irving

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Does great on hardwood floors. The wheels are rubber so no scratching. Love the swivel so super easy to maneuver. Very lightweight. Lays flat to get under a bed. Sucks up cat litter, including the pellets from the Breeze litter system. Sucks up golden retriever hair with no problem. Love that there's no brush to pick said golden retriever hair out of constantly. Filter is washable. The only con I have come up with so far is the location of the power button. I understand why it's where it is but I keep hitting it on furniture and turning it off. Minor details.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Great vac, excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Powerful little vac, perfect for a quick cleanup on hard floors. Rubber wheels don’t scuff, and the head has a rubber bumper so it does not mark the baseboard. Easily picks up cereal or dogfood , does not push it around. Amazing for the price. Update. Had this for three weeks. Performance is excellent. Update. Had this for two years. Still excellent. I clean the filter every three weeks. Never changed it since purchase
customer_reviews.author: Bermuda sun

customer_reviews.title: What's with all the good reviews?!
customer_reviews.text: We live in a pretty small house, hard floors & a couple area rugs. This doesn't cut it. Not enough suction, even after passing over multiple times (with the poorly made swivel flipping & sticking side to side) I was still throwing crumbs & picking up some but not much. Pretty easy to put together, a child could do it. Which is what it's become, a child's toy, my 3 year old likes "cleaning" with the handheld part. Very cheaply made. I'm just gonna buy a better one at a store with displays. I bought this from reading good reviews, don't know how there's so many really. Won't even pick up litter. If I were you I'd pass.
customer_reviews.author: Cheree

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: My 8-year old Jocelyn insisted I write this review because she loves it! She is having fun cleaning up after the holidays with this and says it is a great deal for the price! The long tip lets her stand in one spot and reach far (less work for her to complete her chores!)
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: Excellent vacuum for my tile floors
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this vacuum. Now don't get me wrong. In the beginning I had some trouble getting used to the 360 design but after a few days my love for this vacuum grew. Very good quality. Good design. Great suction on my tile floors. Does well on my area rugs. Cord is a good length. I cant say enough good good things. Love!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Marvici

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and convenient. Wonderful crevice tool so I can get to the tracks on my sliding doors without having to crawl on my hands and knees. Very powerful suction. Visible dusk up so you can see when you have to empty it and an easy rinse filter. Great product excellent value
customer_reviews.author: Richard T

customer_reviews.title: No suction, don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money, not enough suction to pick up anything. Very disappointed and I missed the return by date. I guess I’ll put in the next garage sale.
customer_reviews.author: money2burn

customer_reviews.title: A disappointment all around
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because I was looking for an everyday, small stick vacuum with great suction power for mainly hard floors, but that could also handle the low pile area rug in my mudroom. That is not what I got. You have to go over items multiple times for the vacuum to pick them up and over the rug it is even worse. The only thing it picks up easily is hair and dust bunnies off the hardwood floors. It works ok as a "dustbuster", but I still have to add the crevice tool for it to have any kind of suction (I use this combination around my fireplace).
customer_reviews.author: Heritage Homesteaders

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have hard wood floors. I also have 6 kids and a St. Bernard. . . This vaccum is awesome. Granted we do have to dump the little container 2 or 3 times but so so so much better than trying to sweep. Especially with the ridiculous amounts of dog hair that accumulates that likes to then fly out of the dust pan on your way to the trash. This thing has made my life 100 times better lol
customer_reviews.author: My Redeemer Lives

customer_reviews.title: flat surface only
customer_reviews.text: It's ok for hardwood. It isn't good for carpet. I got it because I have a small area of carpet and didn't want to get a large vacuum for it. I can still use it for around the litter box, but don't expect a lot from this little guy. With the amount of suction, they could have put little carpet rollers or something to help with carpet cleaning. The stand up part is just a hole with plastic in the shape of a vacuum bottom.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Good Value...Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: I'd advise that you spend a few extra bucks for this unit rather than going for the cheaper models like the Dirt Devils (which we also have). You'll get a more powerful motor, more versatility with the swivel head, a slightly quieter operation, and the feel & build quality is just much better. Forget carpet...this is not meant for carpet and I'm always surprised by people who provide negative comments on a stick vac like this for carpets...it's meant for floors...and it does a very good job at that. Very happy with this purchase and may even buy another one shortly to replace our cheaper Dirt Devil.
customer_reviews.author: Chad F

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: The vacum was good while it worked, however i bought it in march 2018 and used only 3 times so far. And now it is not even turning on. Horrible experience. Now i am outside the return window. The worst thing is now I have to go and buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very weak suction
customer_reviews.text: I have a $20 handheld vacuum that works better than this one. This is good only on hard wood floors. On my short haired carpet it does not pick anything that is visible up. My carpet was very dirty with bits of small things on it like short pieces of thread, very small crumbs, tiny normal stuff. This vacuum did not pick ANY of it up. Very disappointing considering the good reviews. Would absolutely not recommend this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What can you expect?
customer_reviews.text: It's a rather cheap vacuum; a stick vacuum. It does what it needs to do. The suction isn't the greatest, but I use it to pick up cat litter and clean the area rug in my basement so I'm not really worried about it being totally spotless. Don't use this for actual carpet. I like the idea of it being a plug-in hand vacuum. That's really the reason I bought it. It is versatile which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth K.

customer_reviews.title: Works great on hardwood floors!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought this vacuum. We have 4 shedding dogs and hardwood floors. It picks up all the hair and dirt and is so light!! I'm physically disabled and find it a dream to use. No more struggling for me. No more happy balls piling everywhere. It also sucks up the litter from the cat box that they toss out. This isn't for carpet. It's awesome for bare floors though.
customer_reviews.author: Shanti

customer_reviews.title: Get something else.
customer_reviews.text: Only used it to vacuum my baby's nursery. It has hardwood floor and a low pile area rug. The rubber strip on the bottom already broke off so it doesn't really clean the rug that well anymore. It worked fairly well before that. I know it's not meant for rugs, but I didn't need something heavy duty. I'll look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Elmo

customer_reviews.title: For mild use only
customer_reviews.text: WARNING, DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT IF YOU OWN A PET THAT SHEDS A LOT OF HAIR. Pros- works for minor dirt and stuff Bagless, open it and empty out Not heavy at all Easy to store and maneuver around Long cord Works best on tiles and wood floor Cons- not meant to pick up heavy or big stuff. Does pick up dog hair but you have to keep emptying it out, its not meant for households with too much dog hair. Mild yes... Hair from a german sheperd. No. Horsepower and suction not the best, not too great for carperts.
customer_reviews.author: J SAN

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat for $30
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is awesome. I use it on my hardwood floors and I couldn't believe the stuff it picks up. Especially because it is only $30! It is extremely lightweight. I even carried it out to my van and vacuumed the inside carpet. Granted, it didn't do the best job in the van but that's not what it's made for anyways. Would highly recommend. I wish the cord was a little longer though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum after my last small vacuum (Bissel) broke into pieces...I love this vacuum. I use it to vacuum up dog hair off wood and ceramic tile. It sucks it up no problem. The swivel portion can be annoying to use at first if you've never used that type of vacuum, but you get used to it pretty quickly. You can also use it as a handheld vacuum to vacuum surfaces such as a couch. An added plus is the product is not all made of plastic, like most small vacuums. I've had issues with plastic vacuums breaking to pieces and this has not done that because it has metal in it.
customer_reviews.author: Em0905K

customer_reviews.title: Love this! i’m disabled and struggle with even light ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this! i’m disabled and struggle with even light vacuum cleaners. brooms just didn’t seem to pick up the stuff on floor in kitchen. this is so light and works great and even gets under cupboards. also picks up off flat pile rugs. and porch. and because it’s electric it never loses suction. can also clean patio door track while standing which is a blessing. got another for a gift.. highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: bev

customer_reviews.title: Highly Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great vacuum! It's lightweight so it's easy to maneuver. There's myself, my husband and two cats in my home and this vac does a great job cleaning the 1300 sq ft of berber carpeting throughout and the laminate wood floor in the kitchen. For the best performance I empty the dirt cup after vacuuming the living room or two smaller rooms. The dirt cup is easy to empty and best of all the filter is washable saving me $$$ in replacements!
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: I'd rate the product "Excellent"
customer_reviews.text: Cleans very well, both carpets and hard floors. Crevice tool is great. Being semi-invalid I enjoy that the machine is light weight and extremely easy to handle. It makes it possible for me to do my own housework. It was affordable for me being on a fixed income. I appreciate that fact, too. I'm very, very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: nonny

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum works great! After moving and not having much carpet anymore my old vacuum would “spit” back peices of dirt back at my feet but with his vaccum picks up almost everything. THe only thing that is a little annoying is that I constantly have to make sure I have it angled right (45 degrees roughly) other wise it won’t pick up dirt but you can hear if it’s getting good suction or not. The versatility is great too so overall for about 30 dollars it’s not a bad vacuum. Worth it and it has replaced my broom for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Motor Gave Out After 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 6 months ago and a week ago while I was vacuuming, the motor started to make a funny sound and a few seconds later, the suction stopped completely. Sounds like the motor gave out. Eureka customer support is worthless, they never got back to me. A waste of $30.
customer_reviews.author: jshah500

customer_reviews.title: Parts unavailable
customer_reviews.text: I like the vacuum. However, the dust cup filter will need to be cleaned frequently. I wanted to order more of the filters so I could vacuum with out stopping frequently to clean it. However, Part N0101 is impossible at present to find even on Amazon. Also if you look further in the answered questions part others have the same problem, a question was dated from 5 months ago so apparently Amazon has been selling this product that you can't get replacement parts for.Also people are having trouble making direst contact with Eureka at present. Amazon should be more up front about parts not being available, would not have bought this had I known.
customer_reviews.author: rex strider

customer_reviews.title: Does the job at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when one of my children accidentally broke the one we had before. Works great for a little vacuum! I don't have pets but I have 4 kids and I keep it next to our dining room table for easy clean up after meals. Sucks up cheerio and goldfish no problem. Also gets most of the little crumbs. Swivel works great with the floor attachment. Easy to pop on and off to use as a handheld. I have even used it on carpet and it's not amazing but does the job for a quick clean up. I am very happy with this unit and would recommend, especially for under $30.
customer_reviews.author: jnaeae6

customer_reviews.title: Not for carpet
customer_reviews.text: Looks exactly how I expected BUT there is only a small like 1.5 inch hole on the bottom of the wide vacuum attachment, so it's useless. Basically this vacuum is a handheld with an extended handle. The suction is very good. It gets up all my pet hair and I do like how light it is. Just wish the vacuum attachment had a wider suction area. I imagine this vacuum is perfect for a very small studio apartment, with little to no carpet. I'll definitely use it instead of my broom for my tile and hardwood.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron/Joanie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight design and functionality!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lightweight design and functionality. Not too noisy. It's easy to convert to all the different configurations. Works great on hardwood floors, around litterbox and on kitchen/bathroom tile. Don't even think of using it on carpets though, except for the lowest industrial kind. Does not have a brush roller, so if your stairs are carpeted, you're out of luck. The crevice tool is useful and it's great that it lives right on the pole so you can grab it and store it easily and not lose it. It's so light I can use the full stick vac upside down for ceiling corners and cobwebs. I still highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Stickler

customer_reviews.title: Great for it being so little and so cheap!
customer_reviews.text: If you live in a one bedroom apartment, and are just looking for something to vacuum your carpet every two weeks, this little vacuum is perfect! I was skeptical at first after seeing how small it actually was, but once I turned it on and vacuumed everywhere and saw the dust and dirt that it picked up, I was sold on it! It picks up a lot for it being small. Great buy, super cheap, works just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for! This thing barely sucks lint off the floor. I wish I would’ve spent more money and got a better product. Live and learn!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: I have a studio apartment with hardwood floors and it is absolutely perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: If you have a small space that has solid flooring, you have to buy this. If you have carpet, or a large home, it’s probably not for you. I have a studio apartment with hardwood floors and it is absolutely perfect for me. The price is great, it cleans wonderfully, and it’s small enough to just stash in the closet. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C Rezzonico

customer_reviews.title: Good enough, I guess
customer_reviews.text: If I had seen this in a store, I wouldn’t have purchased it. It’s flimsy and not super powerful. It’s too much of a pain to return and it was cheap so I’m going to use it until it dies. (I assume a year from now?) I don’t have a big place and I’m using to collect dog hair and dust bunnies on hardwoods and tile. It’s size is helpful for storage but that’s kind of it. I would not recommend this for carpets. All in all, it’s “fine.”
customer_reviews.author: Mary C

customer_reviews.title: Oh, my gosh.  Cats.  We have cats.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered extra filters today because this amazing product is badass. I have short pile carpet where we keep the litter box and this machine loves litter and cat hair. (It disdains the large tufts from our Maine Coon but everything else is toast.) It is very lightweight, glides on its little rollers, and when I was done in two rooms, I dumped an amazing amount of, just, life. We will use our regular vacuum on occasion to do deeper cleaning, but for the daily nonsense. this light-weight, easy moving, machine is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon C. Gant

customer_reviews.title: Save your time, money, and back / knee health.
customer_reviews.text: Save your time, money, and back & knee health. It didn't provide enough suction to actually clean my carpet, just pushed stuff around and blew dust into the air. Fully assembled, it just grinds dirt further into the carpet with its wheels. Suction is better using the handheld portion only, but not satisfactory. Despite being listed as "prime", it took almost a week to arrive. Had to vacuum my entire living room on hands and knees with handheld portion in order for it to pick anything up.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap plastic. It wont be long before something breaks apart or breaks off.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is not nicely made. If you lean it against a wall and it falls, it will break the plastic. I bought one and it ended up breaking sonI bought another because I liked how it was small and easy to maneuver. However after my second one also broke from the cheap plastic, I ended up getting a normal vacuum. I'm sure there are stick vacuums out there that work great but this one is cheap quality and the suction isnt that great. If you have a pet that sheds, you do not want this. It will not suck up hair well at all. I wouldn't recommend this vacuum to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Good luck on finding filters.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!! You cannot find filters for Eureka Blaze 3-in-1 Swivel Lightweight Stick Vacuum. This is an Amazon "Choice" product. Thus one would think Amazon would stock the filters. I discovered this issue long after the 30 day return had expired. Tried going to Eureka BUT their website has been down for weeks. Tried their 800 number but they are only open 9 AM-10PM weekdays, if you can get them to answer.
customer_reviews.author: grey_elf

customer_reviews.title: Great for bare floors.
customer_reviews.text: Just use this for the first time and it worked great on my bare floors. Did vacuum my area rug (I only have the one) and it picked up surface cat hair, but not sure how it would deep clean on a rug or carpet. Very lightweight, head is narrow and not bulky, swivels to get under things. Even picked up cat litter and some cat treats scattered on the floor. Perfect for what I wanted it for. I wish I would have splurged and gotten the newer model after what I have read about not being able to find a filter replacement but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: cathy p

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kitchen floors
customer_reviews.text: The Eureka Blaze is a great alternative to the newer gen dustbusters that can't hold a charge. Less expensive, too. As a handheld on a stick, it is a joy. No stooping. Swivel gets into all the angles of my kitchen better than broom or heavy vacuum. Wider reach covers all the floor surfaces in kitchen, laundry room, and entrances to outside in no more time than it took to spot clean a few small sections with a dustbuster. On carpet it does what I'd expect of a dustbuster, and it's faster. It did well picking up pine needles and other garden bits tracked in from outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper

customer_reviews.title: It’s cheap for a reason
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a poorly functioning handheld vacuum with an attachment that lets you sort of use it as an upright. The attachment is cheap, feather light plastic with no brush, a rather small air hole and 2 tiny little plastic wheels borrowed from a toy car. Oh and a half inch flimsy metal stick that goes into the top. While lack of suction and brush for agitation render it fairly useless as an upright, its long shape and angle of the suction make it an unworthy hand vac as well. Just don’t.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little sucker!
customer_reviews.text: When you are excited about a vacuum....mom life! I read the reviews they sounded good so I went for it. My 7-month-old started crawling commando-style, making herself the human mop, lol! I needed something I could just use every day that was light and powerful, this fits the bill. The head is a little small but is true to how it's advertised so no use complaining. It works great on my wood floors and on the carpeted stairs. Good price with free ship to AK!
customer_reviews.author: Ezina Designs

customer_reviews.title: Performs Very Well for Price Lightweight Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’m giving this product five stars because for the money it doesn’t excellent job! It cleans my laminate floors and tile floors of all the little particles and debris. It’s hard to get cat litter off the laminate floor but I can vacuum the area rugs easily even the stairs and it takes some of the top dirt and particles away. I use my big vacuum to do a really deep clean. It’s super light and easy to maneuver and Tucktaway in a closet. It’s also easy to empty and clean I love the handheld vacuum feature it’s also easy to take apart and reassemble
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Sloan

customer_reviews.title: If only my ex sucked this hard
customer_reviews.text: The Eureka Blaze is next level. As a bachelor living in NYC, I manage to bring into my West Village apartment (flex!) an unholy amount of filth. Apart from the women, I also bring in a lot of dirt and debris. It was all getting a little messy for my liking, enter the MF'ing Eureka Blaze. This vacuum cost next to nothing but it's value is immense. Honestly, it's so bloody good I have been compelled to write this glowing review. Finally - to my ex, if you're reading, you suck - but not in the good way like the Eureka Blaze 3 in 1 Swivel Lightweight Stick Vacuum Cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Miles M McKirdy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it had good reviews and I needed something to keep my kitchen hard wood floor clean. It seemed to work fine for a month or so, and later it barely vaccumed any dust or debris of the floor, it just goes over the dirt and doesn’t vaccumme at all. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: nihal fathima

customer_reviews.title: Good all around. Minor improvements could be made. Recommended
customer_reviews.text: First: It is light and it works well when all together and cleaned up. (As it should be). It is great for under kitchen cabinets kick plates using the focussed pointer device. (What could be better is by having it 'snap/click in' ... it occasionally drops out when in use, since it's retained strictly by force fit). It also could click this nozzle onto the storage spot on the long handle...it sometimes falls off that.. And, similarly, click retention of the large floor attachment into the base for use would be nice. Despite the annoyances, it's still a good tool and value. It would also be nice if it came with an extra filter.
customer_reviews.author: Stoney End

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this vacuum for a month now. It is basically useless as an upright stick vacuum. There isn't a lot of suction power and having the base on it creates more of an obstacle for it. It IS decent as a handheld vacuum though and has no problem sucking up spilled dry animal food and things like that. Three stars because it's not great, but it was only $30 so you can't have very high expectations either.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Better to stick with a broom and dustpan for your hardwood and tile floors....
customer_reviews.text: I've always found Eureka products to be very good to excellent quality in all aspects. However, I have to rate this product as on the high end of poor in terms of it doing its job. Suction power was inadequate from the jump start. On the positive side, it's lightweight, it's swivel feature is nice, and it's easy to empty. But, those things mean nothing in the absence of it not actually vacuuming. I purchased this to replace the need to sweep my hardwood and tile floors, thinking it would be easier and get up more dirt. I was wrong - sweeping does a much better job. I would have returned this product, but I missed the return window.
customer_reviews.author: tiffany247365

customer_reviews.title: A Dustbuster with a handle - but love the long handle!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 dogs. They shed a LOT. Using a Swiffer or microfiber mop works but doesn’t get all the loose fur. And forgot trying to pull the dirty pad off the mop.... I bought this to avoid dragging my heavy vacuum across my hardwoods. And it works! I do have to empty it quite often, so I wish it had a bigger cup. And the tools are pretty worthless. But for picking up all the hair it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: CJH

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive and light weight vac, gets dog hair
customer_reviews.text: We purchased for daily use on new hardwood floors. We have a Shark but felt suction was seriously too strong. With two golden retrievers need to vacuum daily. This is light and easy to use. Does a great job picking up dog hair whether just a few or dog tumbleweed. Cord length is just okay - have to move to cover 25 ft room. And the filter cup had to be dumped after each use but also cleaned with a rag or washed to get the dust, pollen etc off it. It does dry easily overnight but a pain to wash. Would buy a second filter cup if I could find one but haven’t been able to locate one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Chaney

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful suction. I had a dirt devil hard floor vacuum and loved it, wanted to try this one because of its high reviews . No regrets!!!! This is even better than the one I had.. no need to spend thousands on a hard floor vacuum when this little one does the trick.. mainly using to pick up dog hair and mine and my daughters hair that seems to get all over the floors. First use and this little vacuum left my hard floors hair and dust bunny free!! Do keep in mind this won’t pick up big peace’s as it’s sickroom hole is small, but again very powerful suction..
customer_reviews.author: Nrj

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I didn't want to be at the mercy of a battery- I have had too many of those! I have a Black Lab so ya, fur everywhere! Mostly hardwood floors/ tile and small carpets. No problems on any surface, enough power. Cord could be a little longer but no biggie. To make cleaning up easier I use a left over dryer sheet over the unit filter makes clean up instant and don't have to remove the hairs out...and no loss of suction.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C.

customer_reviews.title: Light use only—great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a great option for a dorm room or studio. Works well on hardwood floors as well as carpet. Pros: light weight, easy to assemble, easy to clean, good suction power when brand new. Cons: a bit flimsy; the valve at entry of dirt cup does the job but seems fragile—I guess we’ll see. Very loud motor—again, par for the course with something small. Heats up quickly, so it’s not for prolonged use. As expected: picks up some hair (human or pets) but since it doesn’t have a brush, it’s hit or miss. Overall, does the job it was bought to do. I’m curious how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Hali

customer_reviews.title: unsure how I feel
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, I think. It's great for my small apartment. Cord length and weight is perfect. But, on the hardwoods, I feel like I'm just running over things every so slowly over and over and over again. LOL. Same with carpet. The thing I really do not like: the swivel head. I'll be pushing it forward and it turns on its own and will curve to the left when I just need it to go straight. I'm trying to straighten it out more than vacuum. Great for dry spills: rice krispies on the floor, for example.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Good for small jobs on wood floors.  Not for whole house or carpets
customer_reviews.text: Just unpacked and used this to pick up small particles of crumbs in the kitchen, remove dust around the walls, corners and under furniture. It works well on wood floors. I like the tilting handle which makes it so easy to get under furniture. This unit is not for carpets. Designed for wood floors. This is a convenient tool, easy to use and the price is right. It serves my purpose of cleaning small areas. It beats sweeping ! Crevice tool included for corners and edges. Purchased 2 year warranty. Filter NO101 and Pre-motor filter NO102 are available on Amazon. Bottom line "Good Value for the Price"
customer_reviews.author: JDT

customer_reviews.title: A detailed review
customer_reviews.text: The suction power is a bit surprising for what it looks like but because of how cheaply made it is the cleaner struggles a bit to move on a carpeted surface. It is easy to assemble and good with picking up anything that maybe on your floors. I will mention that once you turn the cleaner off the last bit that was suctioned falls out so I suggest keeping the cleaner on for a few seconds after you are done so that everything stays in the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum itself does not have a lot of suction power but the hand held piece does which is what I really bought it for! To use on my couch and the carpet on the stairs and it sucked up everything and all the dog hair! Works great, don't complain if it doesn't last long....you get what you pay for, if it lasts 3 months then I got my money's worth!
customer_reviews.author: Gina Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing. Died during first use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this due to the good reviews. Got it end of August 2018. Looks good. Versatile enough. Easy to assemble... But boy did it die easily as well. Died during the first use. Went off suddenly. Thought it might be a safety feature when it gets a little warm. Left it to cool down. But would never turn on again. Didn't even manage to finish cleaning 1 bedroom. Now just a piece of garbage to throw. Definitely can not and would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RiGG

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST PET VACUUM EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not only was this extremely affordable (which is always a buyers plus). It has very powerful suction on shag rugs and thick apartment carpet. I was so disgusted when I saw how much cat hair was in my carpet and rug. Mainly because I had been using another vacuum assuming it was getting the job done but clearly it wasn't. I especially like the rolling feature of the flat head because I can clean under my sofa, desk, and chair without moving them around. I didn't buy this for my floors as I have another cleaning system for them.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Patton

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $30 at all, short cord, mediocre, may work in small spaces with hardwood only
customer_reviews.text: Very short cord....minimal suction when the floor head is attached...don't even attempt to use on floor carpeting. Barely sucked anything off of my thin doormat. Works okay on hardwood but if you have a pet that sheds get a real vacuum this isn't worth $30. It's gotta be unplugged/plugged back in from room to room and the filter can be a pain to empty as the fabric around filter goes up into the dome (make sure you push it out to empty ALL dirt from around filter and from canister). Soon as the fabric has hair on it the suction decreases immediately. For $14 more you can get a Bissel at Walmart
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love! Love! Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little vacuum. Actually, it’s more like an electric broom. Instead of sweeping up crumbs in the kitchen I use this little guy and it does the trick!! Absolutely love it. I have hard wood floors through out my home and this is great for quick picker uppers. It is not a regular vacuum and is not great on carpets or thick throw rugs. It is made for quick messes and dog hair lying around. I love this little guy and highly recommend for light jobs, and better than than sweeping with a broom. The price is excellent for this device.
customer_reviews.author: debt464

customer_reviews.title: Low cost eureka blaze 3in 1 vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Received it today. Took a few minutes to set up. Great suction on wood floors, thin rugs, and a expensive thick piled long runner. Considering some of the negative reviews I read, it blew me away how well it vacuums. Very lightweight had no problem with the swival head. Easy to clean. This is a teriffic sweeper. I can't say enuf good things about the suction.thanks
customer_reviews.author: Dixie

customer_reviews.title: “The little vacuum that could”
customer_reviews.text: The little vacuum that could, lol! A great little vacuum for an even better price. It’s well designed and thought out. My home is tiled throughout with throw rugs here and there. This little guy works very well on tile as well as the short nap rugs. I honestly can’t think of anything I would like to see improved upon. If you’re looking to purchase a stick vacuum I strongly recommend you pick up one of these. The suction power is incredible and I don’t see any need for a brush roll. One last item, I really like the long cord as well.
customer_reviews.author: T. F. WhiteTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Not What I’d Hoped
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a Eureka Stick Vacuum when the motor gave up. This is very disappointing in comparison. It is heavier, the swivel vacuum head is annoying because it has a mind of its own and the opening is small so anything much bigger that a pea isn’t picked up. By comparison, the old one was lighter, picked up more, seemed to have better suction and the vacuum head was stationary. This does have an option of removing the swivel head and handle to use as a hand held vacuum however I have no interest in that. I would not have bought this knowing what I know now.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Hard surfaces only. Not good for low pile carpet
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is great for tile and hardwood floors but anything else I would not purchase it. I have a very low carpet length and this vacuum will not pick up anything in the carpet that is not already loose or and if it’s hair that’s not coming out either. This vacuum has great suction power and if you’re on a hard surface it works great for anything. My biggest complaint about this item is that it clogs constantly and every time you empty the dustbin you might as well have to clear the neck. It gets really annoying actually. Every time I use the vacuum I have to unclog it.
customer_reviews.author: wayfaringwarren

customer_reviews.title: Good Little Dust Buster/Daily Sweeper
customer_reviews.text: This product isn’t really for carpet but works fantastic on hard floor surfaces. If you detach the base and use it as a dust buster, it’ll work better on fabric and carpet. I use this daily as a sweeper to pick up dust, dirt and hair that gets tracked in by people and pets. It’s very simple to clean and use. If you’re not looking for an “actual vacuum”, I would recommend this product. As I said, it works great as a daily sweeper on hard surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: porte8a2

customer_reviews.title: Love my Electric Broom
customer_reviews.text: I call this thing my electric broom, because it’s so lightweight- literally light as a broom. Does great for my quick daily run over the hardwood floors. Picks up dust bunnies, small bugs, and scant hair (probably NOT the strongest suction for lots of pet hair). The major drawback is that this is best for hardwood floors and mediocre for my area rug in the living room and bedroom. You should empty after a couple of uses as the storage bin is sufficient, but trash will easily get stuck in corners of the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases that I made on Amazon (and I buy a lot). I was a bit skeptical about buying a cheap vacuum because I was afraid it wasn’t going to work as good. But I was completely wrong! This vacuum is absolutely amazing! I use it to clean my couch, my area rug, my baby’s play area and on my hard wood floors. Basically everywhere. I use it almost 3 times a week and it does wonders. It picks up everything, dust, hair and even big particles. Its so easy to clean, its small and I love how everything comes apart, literally 3 in 1. This vacuum is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Genesis

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my carpeting, so that I wouldn't have to drag out my heavy duty vacuum all the time, but wasn't sure what to expect. The Eureka stick vacuum is just as good as my old Eureka canasta vacuum that I used to have. It works great on my carpeting and, as for my floors, I've moved my broom and dustpan to the back of the closet! This makes my broom seem outdated. It does the job faster and better than my broom, isn't heavier or clumsier to use than the broom,, and is flexible enough to go under my kitchen table to pick up debris quite easily.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Eden

customer_reviews.title: Delightfully surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Delightfully surprised! Bought this for my hardwood floors and 1 area rug. It has great swivel so it can maneuver well in corners and far under couches. The suction works well, I have 2 dogs and it picks up the hair without problem. It was super easy to put together and easy to use. The chamber for debris is small so you have to empty frequently if using for more than small cleans which is fine by me. I returned the bissel crosswave $300 bc it kept spitting out dog hair and leaving behind dirt. I bought this based on the reviews not expecting much and it exceeded my expectations. Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: So it is a little cheesy and feels like it could fall apart. You might have to treat it more gently than another type. It does not stand up well on it's own, just falls over. Capacity to hold dirt is very little and the cord really needs to be about 5' longer to reach from outlet to outlet. It does a pretty remarkable job in sucking up dirt and hair. Overall I'm happy with this purchase. If you have $20.00 to burn and don't want to sweep or lug around a heavy and loud vacuum, you might consider this little vacuum on a stick.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hardwood Floors
customer_reviews.text: We needed a vacuum for our hardwood floors and this one has turned out to be perfect. We considered that cheaper vacuums might not get the job done, but I'm glad we thought otherwise. This one gets everything off of our hardwood floors, including dog fur, and it converts easily into a handheld vacuum. It's also nice and skinny, making it is easy to store. The only flaw I've noticed so far is that it didn't work AS well in vacuuming hair off of the lining underneath our couch cushions. However, it sucked up all of the other particles underneath them very well.
customer_reviews.author: Chinon

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick cleanups
customer_reviews.text: Super suction, super value. I have all tile floors and area rugs. Picks up everything. Obviously with no brush on it, it probably doesn't deep clean the rugs but it sure picks up the visible stuff and because you can see the dust in the canister, I think it sucks it up really well. I used one of those soft brushes that you use to clean veggies with to get the extra dust off the filter. Also it's easy to take off the handle for hand vac. Also turns very easy to get under furniture. Suction is also really good from the edges on the sweeper. Would definitely recommend. Price is great.
customer_reviews.author: Jacmo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: One of my best Amazon purchases. With a dog and a cat, I was sweeping the kitchen and bathroom tiled floors sometimes twice daily to try and keep up with the shedded fur and never feeling like everything had been picked up. This is so easy to pull out as it weighs so little and has great suction power. I love the little piece you can plug into the canister part and get into corners, under and along appliances or even in between the sliding glass doors. It's simple to pop open and dump the fur, crumbs, litter etc into the garbage. Great little helper.
customer_reviews.author: The Real Ms. Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Ok my expectations for this vacuum were that I would have to return it just because it was so cheap and because of a few of the reviews I read. I ordered it to pick up sand and hair mostly. It has really surprised me. At first when I put the floor attachment on,, I don't think I pushed it on tight enough so it didn't work great. When I secured it more, this vacuum picked up everything. No complaints. Lightweight, easy storage. I'm satisfied. I've used it daily for a week, so we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: @katiewentthere

customer_reviews.title: My back thanks me.
customer_reviews.text: I have a really bad back after two surgeries. This little thing is lightweight enough for surface cleaning even for me. It found a pill in my rug I didn't know was there. A reviewer wrote to make it suction better, keep it on a slant and press the part that hits the floor with your foot for a few seconds, only if you feel it isn't suctioning. She was right. If I were you, I'd deep clean with a regular vacuum and use this one in between big cleanings. So happy I got it. Will update in a month.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: This is essentially a children's toy.
customer_reviews.text: I'd highly recommend not buying this vacuum. I needed a compact vacuum with a handle for my small 6" x 8" rug in my apartment. After reading the numerous rave reviews, I purchased this one with my fingers crossed that it would actually work. Unfortunately, the price was far too good to be true. If I had children, I would give this to them as it will serve little to no use to adults for cleaning purposes. If you have carpeted floors, absolutely do not buy, this is not your solution. However, if you have small (really small!) little clean ups around the house this might be your solution as it is petite and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Sushi Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: This little vacuum really sucks but in a good way.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is fantastic for those in-between cleanings. We have a very large and heavy vacuum which is a pain to haul around. If you have a small mess or just need to clean a certain area it makes it a pain to get the big vacuum. Luckily, I found this little gem. Especially for the price, this little vacuum is amazing. It's great on most surfaces but does suffer on thick carpets. It picks up dirt and hair very well. Besides not working great on thick carpet, my only other complaint is that the attachments don't lock onto the vacuum. The floor and crevice tool frequently fall out during use.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J.

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and quick at clean up
customer_reviews.text: what more could you ask for in a vacuum for under $30. Its lightweight, cleans up quick, has great suction power, so far works great on all surfaces that I have in my apartment, hardwood and area rugs. Works just fine on both and from going between both, except for my little area rugs, its too powerful for those. Easy to take apart to switch between vacuum modes. Perfect for a small space, or apartment, maybe even an office. Like I said can't complain for less than $30
customer_reviews.author: Aryn

customer_reviews.title: Great suction!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Dirt Devil Simpli-Stick which broke after just a few months. I had been a fan of the Dirt Devil sticks until that point, but decided to try the Eureka, instead. So glad I did! It is much sturdier and the suction is so much stronger than the Simpli-Stick. It feels like a real vacuum. Plus, the rotating head is a handy feature. I even bought a second one for another area of my house.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Smith

customer_reviews.title: OK... spend your money elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: A bit skinny in size (which is good for spacing don't get me wrong) but it just feels cheap. Can maneuver under and to the left and right pretty good. You REALLY have to go over spots another time to get things vacuumed otherwise it’ll stay on the floor (vacuum towards the middle part of it). Wouldn’t really buy again, just did it because it was cheap.... not that loud of a vacuum, just wish i spent a little bit more money to get a stronger suctioning powered vacuum
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Ariza

customer_reviews.title: Solid honest vacuum
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good honest vacuum. Not gonna change your world when it comes to cleaning but it’s a good vacuum overall. I used to have the little red dirt devil stick vacuum and I can tell you this is a lot lot better. Works great on hard surfaces and you can see the dirt get sucked up even before you go over it whereas the dirt devil you had to go over it a couple of times. Bigger messes like cereal you would have to push it a little slower to allow it to suck it up as the inlet is small. Easily converts to the hand held to use beneath the couch cushions however doesn’t fit underneath my couch.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Le

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price is even better
customer_reviews.text: Great product and price is even better. This is great on all floors and plush area rugs as well. It cleans great and much better than expected at this unbelievable price!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Wow - powerful and useful
customer_reviews.text: This is a very lightweight machine, but being lightweight is its beauty. It is so easy to use. It is chorded, so you won't have to worry about the battery running out while cleaning. I had just used my bulky canister vacuum hours before the Eureka arrived. I went over my floors with the Eureka and it picked up so much dust and dirt that my larger canister vacuum had left behind! I will vacuum more with this machine because it is so easy to plug in and use it since I don't have to hook up hoses. It is very easy to store in my broom closet. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: RMA626

customer_reviews.title: Suprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: I won't lie, for the price I wasn't expecting to be very impressed. But I am really happy with this product, I use it to vacuum up around a cat litter box and it works perfect! Well at least until the filter needs cleaning, which seems to be pretty much after every third use or so if you want to maintain optimal suction. You can tell when its time to clean the filter because suddenly you are just moving cat litter around rather than vacuuming up any of it. I like the detachable features of this vacuum as well. I'd recommend it for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my ceramic tile floor in the kitchen. My autistic daughter is somewhat of a sloppy snacker. There are always "itty grits" on the floor. It gets the stuff up like a charm! I had an earlier model of this that died. They made some good improvements on this one swivel head, easier to get it apart for emptying, you can see inside the dust cup. It's light weight. Good Job, guys.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Works grear and grear value
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised. For an inexpensive vacuum I didnt expect much, but it is great. We have mostly hardwood (with some throw rugs). It works great on hardwood and rugs. Picks up hair (from 3 shedding girls with long hair). Picks up cheerios (from a 1 year old that throws tons of stuff on the floor). Overall really good and great value!
customer_reviews.author: otatsmom

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: This product is no not worth the tim3 to purchase. I am so disappointed It was so hard to vaccum my rug and th3 suction was very light and the hand held the piece kept coming off will not buy this again or recommend it. Now i spent money on this vaccuum and have to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Budget Friendly; Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Feather lite and easy to store out of the way. *Gave 4* rating* not cordless*, but still easily accessible for fast clean up. Swivel worthy around and under furniture and other small spaces. Very satisfied with this stick vacuum. Vacuum suction is fairly good on both hard floor and shagless carpeting, throw towels, curtains, furniture, etc. Reduces the time and overall workload of household chores. I'm so glad I no longer have to sweep up the dust mite, lint, loose hair collection, and foot traffic debris with a stick broom and dustpan... Recommend a long-handled mini scrubby for cleaning out the catch-all canister.
customer_reviews.author: CMARIEGALLEGOS

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: This "vacuum cleaner" is a complete joke. It looks like a toy and it certainly cleans like one. I just received it today and tried it out and I could not be more disappointed with a purchase. I only have carpet in two rooms and no pets so I just needed a little vacuum for my Saturday cleanings. Well let me tell you. This thing? Could not do anything. Even the carpet refresher powder was left behind. I don't know if I'm more mad or annoyed. I'm not sure what product some people received to be leaving 4 and 5 star reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: OMG....ITS THE BEST VACUUM! UNBELIEVABLE SUCTION. AND FOR THE PRICE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a GEEMO VACUUM CLEANER 2 IN 1 HANDHELD, CORDED POWERFUL CLEANING VACUUM ,LIGHTWEIGHT, BUT IT HAD NO SUCTION! AND THE ANGLE OR HEIGHT OF THE ARM LENGTH FROM HANDLE TO BASE OF VACUUM, DID NOT SEEM TO MAKE THE BOTTOM OF THE VACUUM HEAD, LEVEL, WITH THE FLOOR/CARPET. or I'M JUST TOO SHORT AT 5"4. THEN I RETURNED IT AND PURCHASED THE EUREKA BLAZE 3 IN 1. WHAT A NICE SURPRISED DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND BUY THIS VACUUM. MUCH CHEAPER AND FINER QUALITY.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: It’s kind of works to be honest I would stick to a regular vacuum or a dust Buster alone. It doesn’t have enough suction power to clean the floor I have to go over it with a broom just to get the remaining dirt/hair. It works okay as a duster Buster but could be better as well I got the two year warranty, but what’s the point in fixing it if it’s suppose work like that. I’ll Update if anything changes
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: 4-in-1 vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Can’t rave about this vacuum enough. I’ve only had mine for a few days and I’ve already used it three times, it’s so convenient, lightweight and has such great features. The stick removal to turn this into a handheld vacuum is so easy and quick and while advertised as a 3-in-1 this really has four convertible uses. The suction power is great, and by far the best feature of this vacuum is that it doesn’t have a brush near the suction had that gets clogged with hair. Between myself and my two dogs (both shedding breeds) this vacuum is such a great tool for every day quick hair pick up on floors and furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Llewellyn

customer_reviews.title: Terrible vacuum - never buy this
customer_reviews.text: Pros: lightweight cons: everything else! It was annoying to assemble, cheap plastic parts that need to be wiggled together, the turn radius seems handy but it actually gets stuck, very loud, annoying to empty, anonying to detatch for the hand vacuum, and most importantly - the suction is useless! I might as well sweep my carpet for all the good it does, not even very functional on wood floors. A waste of time and money, don't try it go a better route.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller areas
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait till review this product until after I had had it for awhile. It does the job BUT we recently moved to a home with a lot more carpet than we originally had. It’s a great little vacuum for small areas and I live the ability it has to turn into a hand vacuum. However, as someone with 2 dogs who try’s to clean the floors at least once a week or 2 it doesn’t seem to clean as well as a bigger one would.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: This machine really sucks!
customer_reviews.text: I do not usually write reviews but this little electric broom is fantastic. I only wish I had bought one sooner. This really has great suction (beats using a broom and dustpan any day)! It is very lightweight so it is easy to carry where I need it and so easy to use. It doesn't hurt my arthritic shoulders to push and pull ( unlike my full size vacuum cleaner). Just the thing for my hardwood and tile floors.
customer_reviews.author: tweetylii

customer_reviews.title: No suction power at all!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because of the lightweight design. It works fine for picking up small items such as debris, but that’s it! I had to go over the floor multiple times just to pick up crumbs. Another thing, it twists by itself making it difficult to keep the base upright. There is no brush, only a small suction hole in the middle of the bottom, which makes it nearly impossible to reach the sides and corners of any surface. I have already returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia M.

customer_reviews.title: Decent.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum not too long ago and it's decent for the price. The wheels are cheap and It's a little tough to push on carpets or floor mats. Suction power is decent but the little suction hole needs to be much bigger. It falls down easy and hard especially on hardwood floors and that's probably how it will end up breaking. All in all, not bad for $30. The other brands in the same class are straight up terrible, so this is as good as it gets. Good for a backup, but definitely doesn't replace a full-sized vacuum by any means.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor B

customer_reviews.title: Very good for its price!
customer_reviews.text: For such an inexpensive product, it does its job pretty well. With 2 shedding dogs and all hardwood floors in my house, I got tired of sweeping the entire place every. single. day. So I finally decided to pick up a small & simple vacuum. This little vacuum actually has good suction and will even pick up large chunks of hair. It also picks up dirt that my dogs will track in. The filter is easy to remove and clean and it’s light weight so you can just zoom through your house quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

product_meta.title: Eureka NES210 Blaze 3-in-1 Swivel Lightweight Stick Vacuum Cleaner Dark Black
product_meta.description: Color:Dark BlackBreeze through your home with the new Eureka Blaze. The uniquely engineered capture nozzle sucks up everything in its path. The 3-in-1 design and swivel steering make it easy to use and highly maneuverable.
feature_bullets: Eureka's Signature swivels steering improves maneuverability and cleaning efficiency when compared to standard stick vacuums
3-In-1 design with onboard crevice tool allows you to customize your vacuum for your needs. At only 4 pounds, you can take the Eureka blaze anywhere
Eureka's capture nozzle picks up larger debris with ease unlike other stick vacuums that push larger particles around. Perfect for hard floors, area rugs, and low pile carpets
Powerful 2 amp motor picks up particles like dust and pollen, while the washable filtration system captures the debris and improves air quality
18' Power cord and X-Large dust cup ensure you get the job done faster - no more outlet hopping or frequent trips to the trash can with the Eureka blaze. 9. 44 in. cleaning
Much safer and more environmentally safe package. Passed frustration-free packaging (FFP) Certification

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars15,719 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Hand Vacuum^Floor Nozzle^Handle^Crevice Tool^Crevice Tool Holder^User Manual
